{"step_by_step_thinking": "Epidemic typhus causes a centrally distributed rash that starts from the trunk and spreads to the extremities. Measles also causes a centrally distributed rash that starts from the face and spreads downwards. Secondary syphilis causes a rash that can be distributed all over the body, including the palms and soles. Typhoid causes rose spots on the abdomen, which is a central distribution.", "answer_choice": "C. Secondary syphilis"}
